intro: Lessingia virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Lessingia virgata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
